Description: This session will provide a bench to bedside and back again view of therapeutic landscape for malignant glial tumors of the brain which remain some of the most challenging of all cancers.  The presence of tumors in the brain, and their complex biology present major obstacles to effective therapies. However, targeted therapeutics and improved biological understanding and innovation are changing the landscape of possibilities in the field. This session will  illustrate the breadth of approaches and innovation currently under investigation in the clinic as well as recent progress in IDH mutant and BRAF fusion gliomas  (P. Wen). We will discuss preclinical modeling of glioblastoma for improved intratumoral drug delivery and challenges of  translating discoveries from the lab to the clinic (S. Lawler). Insights from studies of epigenetic regulation in IDH mutant glioma (M. Castro) will provide an overview of the major challenges and promise in the field at this time.
